Package com.github.actionfx.core.extension.beans

Class SubscribeMethodBeanExtension

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.actionfx.core.extension.AbstractAnnotationBasedExtension<A,​E>
      • com.github.actionfx.core.extension.beans.AbstractAnnotationBasedBeansExtension<A,​java.lang.reflect.Method>
        • com.github.actionfx.core.extension.beans.AbstractAnnotatedMethodBeansExtension<AFXSubscribe>
          • com.github.actionfx.core.extension.beans.SubscribeMethodBeanExtension
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BeanExtension
    public class SubscribeMethodBeanExtension
extends AbstractAnnotatedMethodBeansExtension<AFXSubscribe>
    Extends beans for methods annotated by AFXSubscribe, which allows a simple publish/subscribe pattern and a loose coupling of ActionFX controllers.

    This extension is realized as "beans" extension and not as "controller" extension, as this extension needs to call methods on beans that may not be instantiated yet on "publish" time (e.g. lazily created beans), while respecting also the bean lifecycle of prototype-scope beans. In order to guarantee this, the bean itself is retrieved with ActionFX.getBean(Class) inside the consumer.

    Author:
    koster

                      boolean lazyInit,
                      java.lang.reflect.Method annotatedElement,
                      AFXSubscribe annotation)
        Description copied from class: AbstractAnnotationBasedBeansExtension
        The actual extension logic is implemented in this method, which receives the controller instance, as well as the annotated element and one annotation.
        Specified by:
        extend in class AbstractAnnotationBasedBeansExtension<AFXSubscribe,​java.lang.reflect.Method>
        Parameters:
        beanClass - the bean class
        beanId - the bean id
        singleton - flag that indicates whether the bean is a singleton (true) or a prototype-scoped bean (false)
        lazyInit - flag that indicates whether the bean is lazily initialized (true) or not (false)
        annotatedElement - the annotated element (e.g. field or method)
        annotation - the annotation applied to the annotated element
